source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Polygalaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1999). Polygalaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Annual or perennial herbs or decumbent subshrubs
Erect perennial shrubs with showy flowers
Leaves ovate to elliptic; flowers all or mostly in lateral racemes; low, wiry subshrub of grasslands and grassy woodlands
Leaves lanceolate to linear; flowers in slender terminal racemes; weedy herbs
Annual; stems stiffly erect; flowers whitish; wings less than half as wide as long, lined by 3 subparallel longitudinal nerves
Perennial; stems ascending to weakly erect; flowers bluish; wings more than half as wide as long, with 3–5 diverging, reticulate nerves
Leafy shrub; leaves elliptic to obovate; wings mostly green on outer surface
Sparsely-leaved or leafless shrub; leaves, if present linear to narrow-oblanceolate; wings coloured on both surfaces
